abstract: A Silicon Valley start-up is said to be promising to blanket San Francisco with free wireless Internet service, reviving a crusade that crumbled last year after two much larger companies, EarthLink and Google, scrapped their plans to build a high-speed network for Web surfing.
lead_paragraph: A Silicon Valley start-up is said to be promising to blanket San Francisco with free wireless Internet service, reviving a crusade that crumbled last year after two much larger companies, EarthLink and Google, scrapped their plans to build a high-speed network for Web surfing.

headline.main: Start-Up Revives San Francisco Wi-Fi Plan
